numbered_ace_sentences: 1. There are only 3 countries.
2. In these 3 countries, adults over 40 years old believe that the world is getting better.
3. In each of these 3 countries, between 45% and 60% of adults over 40 years old believe that the world is getting better.
4. Indonesia is a country.
5. In Indonesia, more than 75% of people who are 15-24 years old think that the world is getting better.
6. In every other country, between 25% and 75% of people who are 15-24 years old think that the world is getting better.
7. I wonder how human development influenced these results.
8. A person can be 15-24 years old.
9. If a person is 15-24 years old, then the person may lose innocence.
10. If a person loses innocence, then terrible aspects of the world become clear to the person.
11. If terrible aspects of the world become clear to a person, then the person may not believe that the world can experience a positive change.
12. If a person gets older, then the person will witness many changes since the years when the person was young.
13. Technological advancements are changes.
14. Medical advancements are changes.
15. Technological advancements can make life more convenient for other people.
16. Medical advancements can make life more convenient for other people.
17. The graph shows that this works the other way.
18. Many countries exist.
19. In many countries, people who are 15-24 years old have high faith in the future.
20. Youthful thinking can cause high faith in the future.
21. Hope can cause high faith in the future.
22. More experience can shatter hope.
23. More years of living correspond to more experience.
24. I live in a town.
25. In my town, the age range of people is a bit over 40 years.
26. This fact makes me intrigued.
27. I want to learn more about our ways of thinking.
28. I want to learn more about our view on future improvements.
29. I want to learn whether future improvements are feasible.
30. The headline is: Has Hope For Our Future Decreased? Here's 40 Countries' Input for Why and Why Not.
